newsitem.title: KENYA: Coffee prices hold firm at Kenya auction.
newsitem.headline: Coffee prices hold firm at Kenya auction.

text.p: Coffee prices rose at the weekly export auction on Tuesday, reflecting higher values in New York and a shortage of coffee, traders said.
An auction official said prices on ABs rose to an average of $141.50 per 50-kg bag from $134.50 last week, AAs to $149.50 from $138.50 and Cs to an average of $135.50 from $127.
"The limited quantity now being offered again contributed to a firmer market," a coffee official said.
The Coffee Board of Kenya said it sold all 21,792 bags of 60-kg offered for sale, against 28,625 sold last week.
